snippet: After 14 years on the national team, Wambach finally has a World Cup title, but not because of her soccer savvy or her brilliant headers that made the team so dangerous in years past.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column observes that American forward Abby Wambach, who took on a lesser role in late stages of Women's World Cup soccer tournament, showed great fortitude as team went on to win its first World Cup since 1999.
lead_paragraph: After 14 years on the national team, Wambach finally has a World Cup title, but not because of her soccer savvy or her brilliant headers that made the team so dangerous in years past.

headline.main: Abby Wambach, U.S. World Cup Team’s Soul, Soars Despite a Lesser Role

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Women's National Soccer Team
